intro: Syringa capitata, commonly known as the clustered lilac, is a deciduous shrub native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its dense, fragrant, purple-pink flower clusters that bloom in late spring. The plant has dark green, elliptical leaves and produces small, woody pods that contain seeds. Syringa capitata thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular ornamental plant in gardens. Its compact growth habit and showy flowers make it a valuable addition to landscape design.
